lexUnit.name: lucky.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of positively-evaluated events or states) be apparantly the result of chance or unknown forces.

sentence.text: ` It 's people like your parents who are lucky , it seems to me , not the other way around .
` There is no doubt the people involved are lucky to be alive , " said a police spokesman .
Of course , some people are very lucky and always know exactly why they are doing things .
His lucky find , three days before , of food concentrate and a slug gun would give him the edge he needed .
Schools of porpoise , dolphin and sometimes even turtles can also be seen but we were n't so lucky that day .

Police say it 's extremely lucky no one was injured or killed .
She 'd be lucky to get anyone in fact .
Then falls upon the lucky one .
People like feeling pity for people , it makes them feel lucky .
Lucky for some !
` What a lucky chance for us both ! "

A mix of all the classic T.V. game shows ` live " while you dine , with prizes for the lucky contestants .
I was very lucky to find this piece of land .
` I was very lucky I did not get wiped out completely , " he says .
We are not so lucky , because our kidneys can not produce such a high concentration of salt in urine .
We were dead lucky to get to bed without a belting on a Sunday . "
And Eleanor was damn lucky to have him as an escort once in a blue moon .
I often think how lucky I am to be her daughter . "
` He was lucky in that too and he had no nerves . "
These three lucky children had everything that they needed .
` I 've been a bit lucky , " he said , modestly .
You 're our lucky charm . "
Well , it was certainly Mickey 's lucky day .

You 're lucky .
